Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Alright I need to figure out which insurance claims are taking too long and why Lets start by looking at each case and calculating how long each took from submission to closure

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 2001 Started at 900 AM on April 1st and closed at 1030 AM so thats about 15 hours Pretty quick

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 2002 Submitted at 905 AM on April 1st and closed at 1100 AM on April 2nd Thats almost 24 hours A bit longer than 2001

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 2003 Submitted at 910 AM on April 1st and closed at 930 AM on April 3rd Thats around 505 hours so over two days Definitely taking longer

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 2004 Similar to 2001 submitted at 920 AM on April 1st and closed by 1045 AM same day So about 14 hours Quick again

Name: Deductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Case 2005 Started at 925 AM on April 1st and closed at 230 PM on April 4th which is about 7225 hours Thats over three days

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: So the cases with longer durations are 2003 and 2005

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Now looking at the attributes Both 2003 and 2005 have High Complexity High complexity probably means more steps or more need for additional documents

Name: Deductive Reasoning - NE
Text: For Case 2003 there are two Request Additional Documents activities on April 1st and another on April 2nd This might cause delays as each request takes time to process

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 2005 has three such requests on April 1st 2nd and 3rd which is even more Each request likely adds time as the claimant has to provide more info

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Looking at the resources Case 2003 is handled by Adjuster Mike in Region A He requests additional documents twice Case 2005 is handled by Adjuster Lisa in Region B who makes three requests Maybe these adjusters are handling more complex claims leading to more back and forth

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: Region wise 2003 is in Region A and 2005 in Region B Its possible that one region has more delays But since both have high complexity its hard to tell if region is the main cause However maybe Region B has slower processing times overall

Name: Hypothesis Generation - NE
Text: The managers involved are different Manager Ann for 2003 and Manager Bill for 2005 Maybe Manager Bill is slower in approving but since 2005s approval is on April 4th its a bit later but Im not sure

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: Finance roles Finance Alan for 2003 and Finance Carl for 2005 Not sure if they contribute to the delays

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Putting it all together the main issue seems to be the high complexity causing multiple requests which extend the process The adjusters handling high complexity claims might need more time or resources

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: To mitigate maybe provide more support to adjusters handling high complexity claims or improve the initial evaluation to reduce the number of document requests Also better communication with claimants could speed up the document submissions
